title: Graph f,accum function g, Find g(6), g'(6), g''(6)

content.description: The graph of a differentiable function f on the closed interval [-3, 15] is shown in the figure above. The graph of f has a horizontal tangent line at x = 6. Let g(x) =  <math> <mrow> <mn>5</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>6</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </math> for <math> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>15.</mn> </mrow> </math>
content.question: Find g(6), g'(6), and g''(6).

topic.text: 6.4: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Accumulation Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
